comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: 1966-1967 color picture of Vought F-8E Crusader 150656 in markings of VF-194 ‘Red Lightnings’ as Modex 407. Tail code NM of Carrier Air Wing Nineteen (CVW-19) assigned to CVA-14 USS TICONDEROGA. A 1966-1967 Vietnam War record for F-8E 150656 with VF-194 as Modex 407: www.gonavy.jp/CVW19-NM1966.html Code NM of CVW-19 aboard CVA-14 USS TICONDEROGA From October 19 1966 to May 29 1967. Originally built under contract as an F8U-2NE, from September 1962 Bu No 150656 became an F-8E. www.joebaugher.com/navy_fighters/f8_7.html F-8E Crusader 150656 was one of 138 rebuilt as F-8J: www.joebaugher.com/navy_fighters/f8_12.html F8U-2NE /F-8E/F-8J info courtesy Professor Joe Baugher, Chicago Illinois F-8J 150656 was one of many casualties of attrition. On July 3, 1969 F-8J 150656 crashed in the Gulf of Tonkin due to possible engine failure. Pilot Lieutenant T. R. Weinal ejected and was rescued. It was with VF-162 ‘Hunters’ as Modex 206 code AH of Carrier Air Wing Sixteen (CVW-16) again deployed aboard CVA-14 USS TICONDEROGA www.ejection-history.org.uk/Aircraft_by_Type/F_8_Crusader... www.joebaugher.com/navy_serials/thirdseries19.html 1969 record for F-8J 150656 with VF-162: www.gonavy.jp/CVW16-AH1969.html F-8J 150656 is recorded with VF-162 as Modex 206 code AH of CVW-16 deployed aboard CVA-14 USS TICONDEROGA for the Vietnam War. And was an “Operational Loss”.
